title: Energy transfer between Zn and water

content.question: A student carefully drops a <math alttext="9.0 gram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solid <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> pellet initially at <math alttext="50.0 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> into an insulated cup containing <math alttext="30.0 grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of water at <math alttext="27.8 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27.8</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The student predicts that the temperature of the water will increase after the pellet is added. Which of the following statements is the best justification for the student’s prediction?

choices.label: The metallic bonds between <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms will break when the <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is exposed to the water molecules, releasing energy that will be absorbed by the water molecules.

Collisions between the water molecules and the surface of the <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> pellet will result in the transfer of energy, increasing the average kinetic energy of the water molecules.

The strength of the hydrogen bonds between the water molecules will increase when the <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> pellet is added, decreasing the average kinetic energy of the water molecules.

Collisions between <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in the solid will increase in frequency when the <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is exposed to the water molecules, resulting in the transfer of energy to the surroundings.

content.answer: Collisions between the water molecules and the surface of the <math alttext="Z n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> pellet will result in the transfer of energy, increasing the average kinetic energy of the water molecules.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
